title: How to Make a Floating Base on Halo 3

steps.headline: First you must be on forge ( editing items on the place)
Next you go in and stack up some crates as high as you want them to be.
Then you put 1 teleporter upside-down on each crate.
Then, you put 1 crate on each teleporter.
First get a teleporter hold it where you want the base
Save the game and then end it
start the game up again teleporter should be floating
Put crate or other item in or on it!
Get an object that doesn't move ex.
Hold it where you want it to be
Save and Quit as mentioned in Method 2
Repeat and you have a massive floating base!
Start forge and go to a map with non movable objects ex.
Place one non movable object on top of another until it is as high as you want it
When it is high enough, delete all objects under the top one
repeat this until you have some floating space to work on
Works best on Sandbox or Foundry

text: Stacking Crates First you must be on forge ( editing items on the place)  Next you go in and stack up some crates as high as you want them to be.  Then you put 1 teleporter upside-down on each crate.  Delete all the crates.  Then, you put 1 crate on each teleporter.  Using the Teleporter First get a teleporter hold it where you want the base  Save the game and then end it  start the game up again teleporter should be floating  Put crate or other item in or on it!  Using Immovable Objects Start up forge  Get an object that doesn't move ex. Bridge, Container, etc Hold it where you want it to be  Save and Quit as mentioned in Method 2  Repeat and you have a massive floating base!  Stacking Immovable Objects Start forge and go to a map with non movable objects ex. bridge, double box etc. Place one non movable object on top of another until it is as high as you want it  When it is high enough, delete all objects under the top one  repeat this until you have some floating space to work on  Works best on Sandbox or Foundry
